comments:
This looks like a reincarnation of bug #135155, bug #132282, or bug #135318. Found during 4.3 smoke testing on 64-bit Linux systems. Was using Sun 1.5.0_08 JVM on EM64T and JRockit on IPF; succeeded with IBM *AND* JRockit on IA32.

Error output is:
Connecting to AC..
org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.exceptions.AgentControllerUnavailableException: Error: Unable to connect to the Agent Controller.Timeout while waiting for connection to complete
        at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.client.core.internal.NodeImpl.connect(NodeImpl.java:132)
        at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.samples.TPTPProcess.main(TPTPProcess.java:78)
Error occurred while connecting to 127.0.0.1:org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.exceptions.AgentControllerUnavailableException: Error: Unable to connect to the Agent Controller.Timeout while waiting for connection to complete

Okay, let's modify that "succeeded" comment. Now that I ran it (once) on Windows-IA32 and actually saw console interation, I realize that I saw *none* on Linux-IA32. Just re-tried and verified. Below is all I saw on Linux:

Connecting to AC..


Connected to 127.0.0.1 at port number 10002




Validate Process - True


Process launched.
Process ID ::=>>25881


Process exited.
Correction to previous comment - this IS working on Windows, failure only on Linux.
This is a regression but is retargetted to 4.4 given that there are no consumers for this yet. I do not have the cycles to resolve this in 4.3
Please commit the patch and test

(In reply to comment #7)
> Please commit the patch and test

The patch is tested.
I can't check it into CVS since I haven't write access yet.
Should I ask someone to do this?
*** Bug 113441 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Resolving defect since patch is checked in

traces.message: Error: Unable to connect to the Agent Controller.Timeout while waiting for connection to complete
